text:
Is it possible to append a new checkbox option via the api? <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/contacts/manage-enumeration-property-options>

I would like to collect the software version number and to manually update the property options would be tedious and would like a way to do it in the frontend.

<@UQERM7BLY> and <@U26BLKGE4> I took the time to read on how to create scheduled jobs on heroku and it seems that this is feasible. Thanks for your help on this, but I still have a question. I figured out how to create a job that will "look" everyday if there is job(s) to execute, but I don't understand how I can queue a job for the future on a specific date. In my program, I `GET` my execution date in a unix date format such as "1609950904" for Wednesday 6 January 2021. I am wondering How I could use this date to queue a job that my heroku process will be able to catch on the proper date.. any idea? I'm using node.js

Hi <@UG7S8J18D>. I am a developer advocate here at HubSpot and I can help out with this question. Goof news! It's possible to append a new checkbox option to a Contact property for example using the API.
However there is one thing to keep in mind. There is not a way to just append or remove a single option, so you'll need to include all of the options you want to keep when updating a property.
This is the API endpoint you can use for Contact properties: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/v2/update_contact_property>

Here is an example of the PUT request payload you will need to make:
```{
    "name": "demo property",
    "label": "demo property",
    "description": "demo property",
    "groupName": "contactinformation",
    "type": "enumeration",
    "fieldType": "checkbox",
    "formField": true,
    "options": [
        {
            "label": "one",
            "displayOrder": 1,
            "hidden": false,
            "readOnly": false,
            "doubleData": null,
            "description": "false",
            "value": "one"
        },
        {
            "label": "two",
            "displayOrder": 2,
            "hidden": false,
            "readOnly": false,
            "doubleData": null,
            "description": "false",
            "value": "two"
        },
          {
            "label": "three",
            "displayOrder": 3,
            "hidden": false,
            "readOnly": false,
            "doubleData": null,
            "description": "false",
            "value": "three"
        }
    ]
}```

This will update the 'demo property' with 3 options. If you wanted to add a 4th option you would send the same payload with the additional 4th option. Let me know if you have any further questions :slightly_smiling_face:

<@UFBDBKQ1H> Thank you for your reply. What I have is a form that currently has a text field "product download". If someone downloads multiple products (visits the same form multiple times) the field gets overwritten.

If I change this to a multiple checkbox this works but having to manually add each new product version would be hard to maintain.

So when someone submits the form I would like to check the "product download" field and append a new value if it isn't already selected instead of completely wiping it out. Is there a way to get this to work with your solution above? Or are these completely different things?

Hello there! I'm wondering if other custom datapoints besides 'id' & 'value' can be passed thru the Events JavaScript API? <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/tracking_code_api/javascript_events_api?_ga=2.240356810.896524234.1578344893-483859917.1566251276>
